intro: Crotalaria lepidissima, commonly known as the velvetleaf crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its palmate leaves with a velvety texture and distinctive yellow-orange flowers. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and it has a sprawling growth habit. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade. Its seeds are encased in a hard, ridged pod, and the plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
